{{Infobox given name | name = Peggy |image= |imagesize= |caption= | pronunciation = | gender = Female | meaning = nickname for [[Margaret (name)|Margaret]] | region = | origin = | related names = [[Margaret (name)|Margaret]] | wiktionary entry = | popularity = | articles = | footnotes = }} '''Peggy''' is a female first name (often curtailed to "Peg"), derived from '''[[Margaret (name)|Margaret]]'''. It may refer to:
In '''literature''': *[[Peggy Kornegger]], academic *[[Peggy Noonan]], author *[[Peggy Parish]], author
In '''entertainment''': *[[Peggy Ashcroft]], actress *[[Peg Entwistle]], actress *[[Peggy Knudsen]], actress *[[Peggy McIntaggart]], model *[[Peggy Mount]], actress *[[Peggy Ryan]], dancer *[[Peggy Shannon]], actress *[[Peggy Wood]], actress
In '''music''': *[[Peggy Gordon (singer)|Peggy Gordon]], musical singer *[[Peggy Lee]], jazz singer *[[Peggy March]], pop singer *[[Peggy Zina]], Greek 'laika' singer
In '''fiction''': *[[Peggy Biggs]], character in ''[[Mike & Molly]]'' *[[Peggy Olson]], character in ''[[Mad Men]]'' *[[Peggy Bundy]], character in ''Married... with Children'' *[[Peggy Gordon (song)|Peggy Gordon]], title of a [[Scottish people|Scottish]] folk song *[[Peggy Hill]], character in ''King of The Hill'' *[[Peggy Mitchell]], character in ''EastEnders'' *[[Peggy Ollerenshaw]], character in ''[[Hi-De-Hi]]'' *Peggy Matsuyama (aka Momoranger), character in ''[[Himitsu Sentai Gorenger]]''
In '''sports''': *[[Peggy BÃ¼chse]], German long-distance swimmer *[[Peggy Fleming]], figure skater
In '''politics''': *[[Peg Luksik]], Pennsylvania politician *[[Peggy Nash]], Canadian politician
In '''art''': *[[Peggy Ahwesh]], American video artist
